bill_title: to require certain persons to take a driving test.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require certain persons to take a driving test. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding § § 32-12-16 and 32-12-42, any person over the age of eighty renewing a driver's license or being issued an original driver's license shall, upon meeting the requirements of this section, receive a driver's license which expires two years after the person's ensuing birthday. Each license shall be renewable one hundred eighty days prior to its expiration. Each applicant shall successfully pass a test of the applicant's eyesight and successfully perform actual demonstration of the applicant's ability to exercise ordinary and reasonable control in the operation of a motor vehicle prior to being issued a license or renewing a license. The fee for such a license is two dollars. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
